chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor D. Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed. 
Defendant shall submit to random observed testing for drugs and alcohol. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek 3 applications a week and document with DOC monthly.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trevor D. Baker in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Trevor D. Baker. Per agreement, defendant will plead to each count. State will be recommending 90 days in jail for each count concurrent, costs, and DNA. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Traffic citations dismissed. Court reviews right lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders: 5 months jail, court costs, no huber, imposed and stayed and places defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions: not to possess or consume any alcohol, not to possess or consume any controlled substances, to submit to random observed drug and alcohol testing, to work full time or seek work at the rate of 3 applications per week and document with DOC monthly, to pay court costs on Ct 2, costs on Ct 1 are waives, and to have such treatment, assessment, counseling,  and programming that DOC deems appropriate.

Defendant Trevor D. Baker appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone for Trevor D. Baker. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s).
Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Trevor D. Baker in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Trevor D. Baker. Amy Hartwig sworn and testified. Exhibit #1- accepted and received. Cross. State heard and moves for bind over. Attorney Bartelt objects bind over and waives argument. Court finds probable to bind matter over. Information filed. Attorney Bartelt requests arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Trevor D. Baker in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Trevor D. Baker. Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Bartelt has been appointed for this case. State requests signature bond. Court orders $500 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
